pycordia package¶

PyCordia - The Discord bot framework¶

Developed by Angel Carias and it’s contributors. 2021.

A wrapper around the Discord HTTP API and WebSockets

Subpackages¶

  • pycordia.models package
    • Submodules
    • pycordia.models.channel module
    • pycordia.models.embed module

pycordia.client module¶

class pycordia.client.Client(intents, cache_size: int = 1000)¶

Bases: object

A WebSockets client for the Discord Gateway API

cache_size¶

Maz size of user and message caches

Type

int

message_cache¶

Client’s message cache - a dictionary of string - pycordia.models.message.Message mappings

Type

Dict[str, Message]

user_cache¶

Client’s user cache - a dictionary of string - pycordia.models.user.User mappings

Type

Dict[str, Message]

async call_event_handler(event_name: str, event_data)¶
event(fun)¶
property guilds: List[pycordia.models.guild.PartialGuild]¶

List of guilds of which the bot is a member

run(bot_token: str)¶

Log into discord, and start the event loop

— :param bot_token: Discord token :type bot_token: str

pycordia.events module¶

class pycordia.events.MessageDeleteEvent(data: dict, bulk: bool, messages)¶

Bases: object

Event called when message(s) deleted individually or in bulk

message_ids¶

The IDs of the message

channel_id¶

The ID of the channel

guild_id¶

The ID of the guild

bulk¶

Whether the deletion was performed in bulk

cached_message¶

The message, if it was cached by Pycordia

class pycordia.events.ReadyEvent(data: dict)¶

Bases: object

Event called when the client is ready.

gateway_version¶

The version used for the WebSockets gateway

user¶

The bot using the gateway

guilds¶

A list of guild IDs the bot is in

session_id¶

The session ID for the WebSockets session

shard¶

The number of shards and their ID for this session

partial_application¶

An Application object with an ID and flags

class pycordia.events.TypingStartEvent(data: dict)¶

Bases: object

Event called when an user starts typing a message

timestamp¶

The ISO8601 timestamp for the message

member¶

The member that started typing

user_id¶

The ID of the member

channel_id¶

The ID of the channel where event was registered

guild_id¶

The ID of the guild where event was registered

pycordia.utils module¶

pycordia.utils.obj_from_dict(data: dict, obj: Callable, alias: Optional[dict] = None)¶

Convert a dictionary data into an obj.

Parameters

  • data (dict) – The data to provide.

  • obj (typing.Callable) – The object created from data

  • alias (dict) – A dictionary containing aliases for any parts of the dictionary. Follows a (param-alias) pair

pycordia.utils.obj_to_dict(obj: Any, alias: Optional[dict] = None)¶

Convert an obj into a dictionary.

Parameters

  • obj (typing.Any) – The object to convert

  • alias (dict) – A dictionary containing aliases for any parts of the object. Follows a (attribute-alias) pair

pycordia.websocket module¶

class pycordia.websocket.DiscordWebSocket(client, bot_token, intents)¶

Bases: object

A WebSockets client for the Discord Gateway API

bot_token¶

A valid Discord bot token

get_identify()¶

Returns an Opcode 2 (Identify) response

heartbeat_interval¶

The interval to wait before calling the gateway again, in milliseconds

intents¶

The provided intents as an integer

async listen()¶

Manage a separate connection for both heartbeats and websocket events

opcodes = {'DISPATCH': 0, 'HEARTBEAT': 1, 'HEARTBEAT_ACK': 11, 'HELLO': 10, 'IDENTIFY': 2, 'INVALID_SESION': 9, 'PRESENCE_UPDATE': 3, 'RECONNECT': 7, 'REQUEST_GUILD_MEMBERS': 8, 'RESUME': 6, 'VOICE_STATE_UPDATE': 4}¶
